result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob James Johnson

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:24 PM Defendant Jacob James Johnson in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Alexander David Goulart appeared in person with intern Margaret Ginocchio by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court sets $1000 Signature Bond with conditions:  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Court orders Defendant to contact Public Defenders office when released. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia or controlled substance without a valid prescription.
